intro: Hylethale purpurea, commonly known as the purple hylethale, is a flowering plant belonging to the Acanthaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its vibrant purple to pink flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a velvety texture. Hylethale purpurea thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth.
